Description: A terracotta front-mould fragment for a standing female saint or beneficent demon, the head and one shoulder only surviving. She has a large parabolic wreath, with a cabled band surmounted by a small circle, and radiating lines on the edges; a small circle on the brow. There are two choker necklets and part of a boss of a further necklace. A mark below the ear indicates where these figures normally have a piercing from front to rear. It has a plain rounded back. Pink Aswan kaolinite clay, with some mica.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Late Roman, sixth to seventh century AD. Comparanda: Near those of 1926,0520.16.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3395)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
